bioghist.p: The Hedgerow Theatre was founded in 1923 by Jasper Deeter in Rose Valley, Pennsylvania. Deeter’s creative energy drew many talented actors, playwrights, and directors to Hedgerow, earning Hedgerow an international reputation and the distinction of being the first resident repertory theatre in the country. Hedgerow became a meeting ground for major actors of stage and screen in the 1920s and 1930s and is considered the precursor to such innovative theatre companies as People’s Light and Theatre Company and Freedom Theatre.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photographic images and papers of the Hedgerow Theater Repertory Company. The bulk of the collection consists of negatives and photographs of actors, productions, sets, and the theater building. Photographs date largely from the late 1930s and early 1940s. This collection also includes a small number of publicity materials for the theater. Materials include program copy and press releases for various productions, including Candida, Twelfth Night, The Inheritors, and Beyond the Horizon.
